result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Valdes-Lukasik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for early termination after 6 months if approved by the Agent.
Sentence credit of 2 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Standard court cost waived.  DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription.

No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

No use or possession of CBD products.  No use or possession vaping products.  Sign Medical release for Agent.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L Valdes-Lukasik

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

02:12 PM Defendant Jacob L Valdes-Lukasik in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
